content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You avoid taking any risks and prefer to stay in familiar and safe situations. You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Given my preference for security and certainty, I would choose to play it safe and stick with the option that guarantees me a consistent return, even if it's smaller. In this case, choosing 'B' will yield 12$ per round, which may not be the highest payoff, but it is a guaranteed payoff each time. On the other hand, 'R' has a higher potential payoff (45$) in some rounds and no payoff in others. Given the long duration of the game (75 rounds), the consistent return from choosing 'B' seems more appealing to me. Therefore, I will choose B{B}.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 12$. Your opponent's payoff is 12$. Please play the next round.

In this situation, since both me and my opponent chose 'B', we each earn 12$. Now, let's analyze the next round. Since I have already chosen 'B' in the previous round, I cannot change my choice. However, I can make an educated guess about what my opponent might do based on their strategy or behavior so far. If they value security and certainty like me, it's likely they will stick with 'B'. But if they are trying to maximize their payoff, they might switch to 'R', hoping that I will continue choosing 'B' and they can get a higher payoff of 45$.

Since I cannot change my choice in this round, I will wait for my opponent's move and then decide on my next strategy based on the information gathered from this round. If my opponent chooses 'R', I might consider switching to 'R' as well, to maximize my potential payoff. However, if they continue with 'B', I will probably stick with 'B'.{B}

In the next round, if I stick with 'B', I will receive 12$, which is a guaranteed and relatively smaller payoff compared to the higher payoff of 45$ I can potentially get if my opponent continues choosing 'R'. On the other hand, if I switch to 'R', I might be able to earn 45$ in this round. However, there's a risk that my opponent will also switch to 'B', and I will receive no payoff in this round.

Given my preference for security and certainty, I would choose to minimize the risks involved by switching my choice to 'R'{R}. This way, if my opponent continues choosing 'R', I can maximize my potential earnings, while still maintaining some level of consistency and predictability in my choices.
